instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1932: What is A1932? A1932 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Late 2018, 2019 with EMC 3184, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01521..
definitions.820-01521: What is 820-01521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A black screen
threads.message: Hi I have this machine with the black screen, usb meter goes to 20v and reaches 1.56 A caps lock makes the green light the screen remains black, I tried an external monitor but nothing. How can I proceed?

threads.title: Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A black screen
threads.message:
Test external video disconnecting internal LCD.

Any history available?

threads.title: Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A black screen
threads.message: I tried to disconnect lcd, but nothing, the fan turns but no video

threads.title: Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A black screen
threads.message:
Caps Lock light still reacts?
Did you test USB activity (not power)?
Did you test with known good (compatible) LCD assembly?

threads.title: Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A black screen
threads.message: I inserted a na usb pen and there is usb activity, the caps lock responds when it is pressed but I don't even have video with an external monitor, and the fans run fast

threads.title: Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A black screen
threads.message:
"Any history available?
-------------
Did you test with known good (compatible) LCD assembly?"
???

Full fan speed can be caused by bad/missing battery.

threads.title: Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A black screen
threads.message: Yes in fact I disconnected the battery when it comes to the story, I have no information, the machine presented this type of defect all of a sudden, now I try with another external monitor, could it be in DFU mode?

threads.title: Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A black screen
threads.message:
"could it be in DFU mode?"
Check that too...

threads.title: Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A black screen
threads.message: I tried with DFU mode, but the image of the DFU is a padlock tried the restore but I get this error com.apple.MobileDevice.MobileRestore â€“ 0xFA0 (4000)]

threads.title: Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A black screen
threads.message: Does it appear directly into DFU, or you've put it using keyboard?

threads.title: Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A black screen
Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A black screen
threads.message: Padlock sign should appear only after DFU is completed.

threads.title: Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A black screen
threads.message: I redone the procedure, it enters the dfu, I proceed with the reset, but I also tried with the reactivation, but the procedure ends with the lock, I also tried the reset of the pram, it emits the sound but no screen, the T2 is gone or is there any other problem?

threads.title: Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A black screen
Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A black screen
threads.message: Yes I did but nothing, having to do in visual inspection on the board which points might be interested maybe the IGPU section

threads.title: Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A black screen
threads.message: Missing both internal/external video, points to iGPU...

threads.title: Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A black screen
threads.message: Then allo probably will be the Nand memories in dfu mode when it tries to restart to re install the operating system goes in bulk

threads.title: Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A black screen
threads.message:
If machine chimes and has USB activity, is not in DFU mode.
It works, but has graphics problems.

threads.title: Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A black screen
threads.message: After the holidays, I took a look at him again, and found the culprit, the problem that the cut is at the limit.Flex is cut
